description.narrative: Saameynta project initiation phase aims to develop a full-stakeholder consented, high-quality project document, based on demonstrable in-depth situational understanding and analyses, informed by the assessments.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
# Gender and conflict sensitive urban tools, systems, strategies, developed/ completed in 3 target cities -
Functioning monitoring, evaluation and learning mechanism in each Municipality in place.
% of DACs in each municipality utilize the online citizen dialogue platform Consul - Baseline: x Target: x Indicator: # city extension/ neighborhood plans developed for DACs through stakeholder participation

comment.narrative:
# Bylaws, and /or strategies, one map-based info data management system and one set of tools officially adopted for each target cities - Baseline: x
# of land-based institutions strengthened or established - Baseline: x
Saameynta project launched 2 additional project cities identified

1. feasibility studies through consultation to identify strategic approaches, viable models and tools and capacity needs
1.2 Stakeholders Engaged: DACs, investors, local government, civil society and int’l partners in planning and investment projects for DS.
1.3 Relevant institutions at state and federal level are supported to review and develop roadmaps, strategies and policies enabling upscaling of durable solutions at all levels. Incl. monitoring and evaluation
1.4 Communities engaged: Community based planning, effective beneficiary targeting, and the use of online citizen dialogue platform Consul inform accountable investment that benefits the DACs.

- Saameynta project launched (carried from 2020). - 2 additional project cities identified (carried from 2020). - Government and community agreed on mechanisms to develop area-level outcomes as well as M&E. - Map-based analysis of socio-economic status, tenure security, functionality of urban services, housing and land markets of DACs developed. - Private sector readiness to invest in direct and ancillary opportunities as a result of Saameynta ascertained, standard packages/guidance for private sector investment developed. - Land administration tools including land and property registration, land valuation and land value capture in each of the three locations developed. - Project document delivered.

1.• Stakeholder consultations are ongoing at FGS and FMS levels in different aspects of the proposal. • A proposed Two-day mission for eco-system mapping of actors and initial stock-taking exercise in Baidoa, including with IDPs had been scheduled. Instead, it was shifted to an online consultation through the Baidoa innovation hub due to logistical issues, to be continued.
1.2• In discussion with government partners—MoIFAR and MoPWHR, Saameynta Project Development team developed a set of criteria (Annex 1) to gauge the readiness of several cities affected by displacement to implement the project. The criteria include issues such as: IDPs vulnerability to disaster and climate change, urban-rural connectivity, presence of private sector, and readiness of local government and land administration to address land dispute and tenure security.
1.3• Recruitment of Gender and conflict analysis expert done and joined early October. • Gender and conflict analysis will develop a gender-sensitive baseline data and M&E and supports the development area-level outcomes in each project locations.
1.4• Recruitment of GIS/Land-use mapping expert is ongoing, expected starting date of deployment: 15th September
1.7 Design of the Project Document:
• Development of Saameynta Project Document is progressing well. The ProDoc Outline has been developed and populated and undergoing editing and consultation with partners. • To advance the ProDoc development, principal partners produced a zero draft of the ProDoc and allocated responsibilities accordingly to write narratives based on each of the principal’s area of expertise. The first full draft shared for review by the partners was done towards end of August.

- Launch Event, familiarization of Stakeholders with the process - One assessment to identify 1 - 2 additional implementation cities beyond Baidoa (conducted through missions to 3 - 4 possible additional locations, meetings with local stakeholders and one workshop); - Consultation processes, involving a variety of government and community stakeholders to start the process of developing area-level outcomes (at least 3 processes, one per implementation city), including a gender sensitive monitoring and evaluation system. - One map-based analysis of socio-economic status of DACs and one assessment of land tenure security, functionality of urban services, housing and land markets. (at least 3 analyses and assessments, one per implementation city) - Assessment of private sector readiness (including mapping of investors and for development of investment packages) (at least 3 assessments, 1 per implementation city), SOPs for private sector engagement in the delivery of public assets and services - Design a fit-for-purpose land administration tools including land and property registration, land valuation and land value capture.

Output 1.1: One assessment to identify 1 - 2 additional implementation cities beyond Baidoa (conducted through missions to 3 - 4 possible additional locations, meetings with local stakeholders and one workshop) – [completed August 2020]:
Output 1.2: One map-based analysis of socio-economic status of DACs and one assessment of land tenure security, functionality of urban services, housing, and land markets (at least 3 analyses and assessments, one per implementation city)- [partially achieved May 2021 - The output was achieved in Baidoa only]
Design of the Project Document [completed December 2020]:
Consultation processes, involving a variety of government and community stakeholders to start the process of developing area-level outcomes (at least 3 processes, one per implementation city), including a gender sensitive monitoring and evaluation system- [Partially achieved May 2021 - The output was achieved in Baidoa only]:
Output 1.4: A fit-for-purpose land administration tools including land and property registration, land valuation and land value capture- [Partially achieved March 2021 - The output was achieved in Baidoa only ]:
